SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of Peer-to-Peer Lending relative to the peak of Venture Capital in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  Peer-to-Peer Lending is to the {left} of the peak of Venture Capital.

VPR.Q: What distribution pattern does the ridgeline representing Venture Capital show?
VPR.A: The ridgeline representing Venture Capital shows a {Single Peak Distribution}.

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Venture Capital} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =-4.6?
EVJ.A: At X =-4.6,the label with the highest density is {Venture Capital}

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Peer-to-Peer Lending or Venture Capital?
NC.A: {Venture Capital} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Stock Market or Venture Capital?
NC.A: {Venture Capital} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {0} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Venture Capital}
